text: [Music]
so my name is andrew smith lewis i'm
co-founder and CEO of Surigao Surigao
operates on a global basis we have about
500 clients around the world
fundamentally the mission at circo is to
make people smarter we're very
passionate about this idea that we can
marry some AI with some brain science to
improve how people learn and to help
quantify what they know and to discover
things about them as learners we were
doing a little bit of on-prem hosting
for our own stuff and then we were using
some shop that was offering some limited
functionality in the cloud we all work
with AWS because all our services are
supported in the cloud from content
creation to our learning algorithms to
our deployments everything is done in
the cloud we power some MOOCs one out of
the Middle East which you know will spin
up 250,000 users in a weeks notice and
we're able to do that without any
concern about the system falling over
we're using some narrow AI to improve
learning and outcomes and that ranges
from a machine learning algorithm that's
figuring out what learners know and
when's the optimal time to represent the
data to them to services like natural
language processing to be able to use
services like ec2 and s3 and lambda to
support that infrastructure and to be
able to manage the data and the speed at
which we need to be able to access these
machine learning algorithms is is great
and so we would not be able to afford
that sort of scalability and the ability
to store all that data if it weren't for
the cloud we've had such a great
advantage in being the AWS cloud the
savings on the financial side great
can't deny that but the savings on the
human capital side are tremendous
you
